zombie.name: Melissa
zombie.backstory: School counselor for 15 years. ALWAYS felt like something was wrong with me - losing my keys 10 times a day, missing meetings, starting 47 projects and finishing NONE. I was the MESSIEST counselor with the BEST results because I actually UNDERSTOOD my students. But I didn't know WHY. Got diagnosed at 42 after my third job loss in 5 years. Everything finally made sense. The scattered brain, the emotional dysregulation, the time blindness... it wasn't a character flaw. It was ADHD.
zombie.dramaticMoment: My rock bottom was sitting in my car in the school parking lot after being let go AGAIN. They said I was 'disorganized' and 'unreliable.' I SOBBED for two hours. Called my sister and she said 'Mel, have you ever been tested for ADHD?' Three weeks later, I had my diagnosis. I remember reading the results and CRYING - not sad tears, RELIEF tears. I wasn't broken. My brain just works DIFFERENTLY. That was the day everything changed. ðŸ§ ðŸ’œ

zombie.videoTestimonialScript: Hi, I'm Melissa. Five years ago I was sitting in my car SOBBING after losing my third job. They said I was disorganized. Unreliable. I believed them. Then at 42, I was finally diagnosed with ADHD. [PAUSE - emotional] Everything made sense. I wasn't broken - my brain just works differently! Now I help other women who got missed. Last month I made over forty-six hundred dollars helping women FINALLY understand themselves. If you're watching this and you've always felt different, like something was wrong with you... I SEE you. And there's a name for what you have - and it's not a flaw. It's actually your SUPERPOWER once you learn to work with it.
